content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced pancreatic clear cell carcinoma with liver and lung metastases, NTRK fusion positive

Previous treatment:
Cycle 1-4 FOLFIRINOX March-May 2024
Commenced Larotrectinib 100mg BD June 2024 following molecular results

Current medications:
Larotrectinib 100mg BD
Creon 25,000 units with meals
Lansoprazole 30mg OD
Oxycodone MR 30mg BD

Current situation:
Pre cycle 3 assessment on Larotrectinib

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is tolerating treatment well overall. The initial grade 2 transaminitis has resolved following temporary dose interruption and she has maintained stable disease on imaging. Her main symptoms are improving with better appetite and reduced abdominal pain. Weight has stabilized at 64kg.

Latest CT (15/07/24) shows stable disease in pancreatic primary (4.2cm vs 4.3cm) and hepatic metastases. Small lung nodules unchanged. No new sites of disease.

Blood results show normal LFTs, stable CA19-9 at 450 (previously 480).

Examination reveals soft abdomen with no masses or tenderness. ECOG performance status remains 1.

Plan is to continue Larotrectinib at current dose with next CT scan in 8 weeks. Will review in clinic in 4 weeks with blood tests including LFTs.

cancer_timeline.value: Commenced Larotrectinib 100mg BD following molecular results
Temporary dose interruption of Larotrectinib due to grade 2 transaminitis
CT shows stable disease in pancreatic primary (4.2cm vs 4.3cm) and hepatic metastases, unchanged lung nodules

patient_facts.value: soft abdomen with no masses or tenderness
improving appetite and reduced abdominal pain

status_updates.value: Metastatic pancreatic clear cell carcinoma showing stable disease on Larotrectinib following initial FOLFIRINOX. Recent transaminitis resolved with temporary dose interruption.
Stable disease on imaging with stable CA19-9
Grade 2 transaminitis resolved following temporary dose interruption
Review in clinic in 4 weeks with blood tests including LFTs
